svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Prevalence of stunting vs. improved sanitation facilities, 2010
The share of children under 5-years old who are stunted versus the share of the total population with access to
improved sanitation facilities. A child is defined as stunted if their height-for-age is more than two standard deviations
below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. Improved sanitation facilities include
flush/pour flush (to piped sewer system, septic tank, pit latrine), ventilated improved pit (VIP) latrine, pit latrine with
Improved sanitation facilities (% of population with access)
Prevalence of stunting, height for age (% of children under 5)
Source: World Bank, World Bank – WDI
